metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13093 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in fs/xfs/xfs_icache.c in the Linux kernel through4.17.3. There is a NULL pointer dereference and panic in lookup_slow() on aNULL inode->i_ops pointer when doing pathwalks on a corrupted xfs image.This occurs because of a lack of proper validation that cached inodes arefree during allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13093` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-raspi2 - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1033-gke - 5.4.0-1033.35
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1007-raspi - 5.4.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1

No subscription required
